"In deciding who should take the business forward, we wanted someone with the right mix of leadership, vision and hard-core engineering chops," Steve Ballmer said in an e-mail to all employees Wednesday. We wanted someone who could define the future of business computing and further expand our ability to bring the cloud to business customers and developers in game-changing ways. has joined the Defending Social Security Caucus newly organized by fellow Democratic Sen. Bernie Sanders of Vermont. "Social Security has not contributed a dime to the debt or the deficit," he said, calling the program rock-solid for at least another 27 years. That was a reference to the moment when Social Security's trustees project that the system's trust fund-- financed by payroll taxes that are segregated from other federal levies-- will run out.

Donald Rumsfeld suggests that President Bush was at fault for not doing more to resolve disagreements among senior advisers.
